title: 820-3115 with no backlight
message:
Hi there, new to the whole board repair stuff, so please bear with me

Got a 3115 with a huge hole by the LCD conn. pins 21 and 22
caps c9796 and c9020 were blown off.

with U9701 removed (looked messed up) and both aforementioned caps removed, I have full continuity to ground from pin 5 of U9701.
also full continuity to ground from the pads under pin 1 of both the C9796 and c9020.

any pointers of where to start?
again, sorry if I am clueless..

EDIT: History is liquid damage around the LCD and U9701 area. not previously worked on.

title: 820-3115 with no backlight
message:
Looks like you have a short in the board from PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT to GND. Sometimes you can dig it out at the LCD connector but many times you will have to lift every component on that line and run a wire to make your own rail. 
Don't dig too much around the LCD connector or risk messing up other traces. Do you at least have an image without backlight?

title: 820-3115 with no backlight
message:
Thanks duke. Yeah i do get image, just no backlight.

Shit, this is going to be a pain in the bumhole..
I did indeed do some digging at the C9020/C9796 area, but I can't seem to remove the short; it's only becoming more gross-looking. (L9080 is standing on the edge of a giant crater the size of fucking grandcanyon)

So i would have to run wires from and to every component on the PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT line, without them touching any parts of that original trace, right? Doesn't that mean i have to start at pin 5 from U9701? I can't use the probe point there, so i was thinking to attach a wire to the IC itself and have that run to the caps at the LCD Connector (which, in turn need to be off the board) ?
I guess i could mount the caps standing up?

title: 820-3115 with no backlight
message: Yup everything needs disconnected. You can forget about the small caps like C9020. I don't know how much time you have to waste, but I don't think I would bother with something like this.
